text.__SUMMARY__:
Grevillea nudiflora  is shrub which is endemic to an area on the south coast of Western Australia.
It is variable in habit, ranging from prostrate to up to 2 metres in height. Its flowers mainly occur between mid-winter and late spring, but it can flower sporadically throughout the year. The flower colour is predominantly red or occasionally deep pink, with a blotch of yellow or grey.
